text: The core of Saul's disobedience was that_____________

options.B: He refused to carry out God's assignment on eliminating the Amalekites
options.C: He didn't perform the task of smiting Amalekites to the letter
options.D: He preserved the booty for himself

explanation: Saul actually carried out Gods assignment to destroy Amalek. The gist of his disobedience was that he didn't perform this assignment according to the prescribed instructions, he spared Agag and reserved choice animals for himself

text: God instructed Saul to utterly destroy Amalek because___________

options.A: He abhors Idolatory and all forms of Unrighteousness
options.B: Its people opposed the Israelites on the way after departing Egypt
options.C: Its people encouraged Israel to disobey God
options.D: Samuel had prayed for it destruction

explanation: God punished the Amalekites primarily because they obstructed the Israelites on the way after the latter had escaped Egypt

text: One of the most significant lessons from the emergence of Deborah as a leader is that_________

options.A: She not only prophesied but also advised Israel
options.B: Gender difference isn't a limitation to leadership
options.C: Honesty and Integrity are key to leadership
options.D: One needs to summon courage as a leader to solve problems

explanation: Even at a time when Israel had no regard for women's perspective in leadership, Deborah's rare leadership quality and value of her advice especially during Jabin's oppression of Israel is by far the most significant lesson surrounding her 'emergence' and recognition as their leader.

text: Jeremiah prophesied God's punishment of the Israelites because they had_______

options.B: Committed atrocities with their neighbors' wives

explanation: The Israelites forsaked the worship of God, who had brought them out of Egypt, for the worship of foreign gods. Jeremiah prophecy surrounded this with the message of hope in case of repentance.

text: Jesus healed the lame man who had been sick for thirty-eight years at?
explanation: Bethsheba, specifically at the pool of Bethsheba by the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem, Jesus healed the lame man on a sabbath

text: St Paul's condition for the attainment of justification is by ______?
explanation: In St Paul's viewpoint, we can only be justified by faith in the resurrection of Christ Jesus and by mere strict obedience to the law. He used the example of Abraham to support his stance.

text: The model example for wives in Christian families according to St Peter is _____
explanation: Sarah is the correct answer.St Peter advised that wives look up to Sarah, who hoped in God and referred to her Husband in Obedience as Lord.

text: According to Luke, Jesus was standing by the......He thereafter entered into the boat preaching and later 'calling' Simon Peter __________
explanation: The Lake of Gennesaret is the Correct answer, as according to luke, this was where Jesus stood before entering the boat to instruct Simon peter to cast his net into the sea for a ctach and later calling his as a disciple

text: One significance of St Paul's teaching on Resurrection is that__________

options.A: Christians must not underestimate the power of baptism by immersion
options.B: As Christ rose and ascended into glory, so as also must uphold the observance of law
options.C: The foundation of their hope of salvation is in Christ's resurrection
options.D: The second coming of Christ is near

explanation: The resurrection of Christ is the basis of the Christian Faith, it is the hope of salvation upon which Christians rely

text: Jesus charged Christians to express love just as________

options.A: He taught them the new commandment
options.B: They would do with their neighbours
options.C: He laid his life for the sake of mankind

explanation: Christians are to show love to everyone as Jesus Christ did when he made the supreme sacrifice for mankind through the shedding of his blood

text: Elijah fed on _____ after declaring drought upon the land of Israel
explanation: After his pronouncement of drought upon Israel, Elijah fed on 'bread, meat and water'

text: A Christian can demonstrate that he is light of the world by___________

options.A: Advocating for the meek to inherit the earth
options.C: being merciful to persons in need

explanation: Being a light of the world, a Christian must Endeavour to uphold good moral value so much so that non-believers may emulate this for general social progress

text: Peter healed Aeneas who had been bedridden for ____ years?
explanation: Aeneas had been paralysed for eight years before Peter healed him

text: St. Peter's teaching on Civic Responsibility centers upon_____
explanation: St Peter emphasized on the qualities of a good citizens which includes, among other things, respecting the authorities

text: St Paul, in 'Law and Grace', although man was condemned, he has been redeemed through the _____

options.A: Compliance to the laws of the God

explanation: St Paul explained that mankind was condemned because of the Sin of Adam, but through the Grace of God and the righteousness in Jesus, Mankind was redeemed

text: Summarily, St Paul in his teaching on 'New Life In Christ' advised Christains to ______

options.A: Endeavor to be baptized by immersion
options.B: Pray for the Grace of God
options.D: Dwell richly in the word of God

explanation: All in all, St Paul advised that Christians make the word of Christ their guiding principle which should dwell richly in them.

text: The core of St Paul's advice on dignity of Labour is that

options.A: Christians must work hard to actively support the Church and themselves
options.B: The lazy people must be made to learn in the hardest way possible
options.C: Everyone should actively contribute to social progress

explanation: The gist of St.Paul's teaching on "Dignity of Labour' is that laziness and indolence must not be condoned. Hence Christians must be productive.

text: Peter advised Christians to _______as they were sharing Christ's sufferings
explanation: Seeing as their reward is in heaven and that they share in the burden of Christ, St Peter advised that Christians "rejoice" even in the midst of suffering.

text: The accusation of blasphemy against Moses, the law and God was levied against _______
explanation: The Jews falsely accused Stephen of Blasphemy against Moses, the Law and God and that he claimed Jesus would destroy the temple.

text: St. James in the teaching on faith and work gave the analogy of ________

options.A: A man who looks himself in the mirror and appreciates God for that
options.B: A hungry man who approached his fellow Christian for help
options.C: A man of little faith encouraging others to work
options.D: A poor man with wretched clothing approaching the rich for help

explanation: St James liked his teaching on Faith and work to the situation of a hungry man who approached his fellow Christian for help but who was rather told to "Go in Peace; be warmed and filled'.

text: One of the following is not a condition for effective prayer according to St James_____
explanation:
Some of the conditions for effective prayers are steadfastness, perseverance and faith.
Lowliness is not considered a condition for effective prayer by Christians according to St James
James 1:2 – 8James 1:2 – 8, 5:13 – 18

text: To St Paul, Christians can prepare for the second coming of Christ by______

options.B: Spreading the message of Christ's coming far and wide

explanation: All that Christians have to do in preparation for the second coming of Christ is to live righteous lives with strong faith in the redemptive work of Christ

text: The significance of the last supper is evident in all but one of the following-------

options.B: Prediction of the suffering and death of Jesus
options.C: Re-establishment of the Lord's covenant with his Children
options.D: The prophecy of Peter's denial of Jesus

explanation: All the other options reveal Jesus usage of the last supper to foretell certain events except that he re-established the Lord's covenant with his children through Abraham

text: St. Paul showed commitment as a means upon which forgiveness can effectively thrive by_______

options.A: Appealing to Philemon to forgive Onesimus and accept him back as brother
options.B: Asking that Philemon to Charge to his account whatever Onesimus owed
options.D: Instructing Philemon to write off all the debts of Onesimus, if any compassionately

explanation: St.Paul demonstrated to Philemon that he truly wanted him to forgive Onesimus by undertaking the extra responsibility of paying whatever sum Onesimus owed

text: The triumphal entry was in fulfilment of the prophecy of_______
explanation: Prophet Zechariah foretold the Truimphal Entry of Jesus

text: "I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities". By this statement, God gave them ______
explanation: God's message to Prophet Amos on the Failure of the Israelites to repent despite plaguing them with hunger and scarcity. (Amos 4:6)

text: God instructed Saul to utterly destroy Amalek because_____

options.A: Its people encouraged Israel to disobey God
options.B: He abhors Idolatory and all forms of unrighteousness
options.C: Samuel had prayed for its destruction
options.D: Its people opposed the Israelites on the way, after departing Egypt

explanation: God punished the Amalekites primarily because they obstructed the Israelites on the way after the latter had escaped Egypt

text: St. Paul had already boasted to the ______and for this reason he sent a reminder letter to the ______ on Christian giving
explanation: click here

text: "It shall be neither mine nor yours; divide it" what was to be divided?
explanation: Reference here is made to the wise decision of King Solomon in deciding the case of the two women contesting ove a Live Baby

text: St. Paul's teaching on forgiveness primarily shows that________

options.A: Subordinates must regard their superiors and vice-versa for forgiveness to thrive
options.B: Genuine forgiveness only comes from God
options.C: Christians must not institute a 'Master-Servant' relationship contract
options.D: Philemon had unilaterally decided not to accept Onesimus back

explanation: St Paul emphasized the reception of Onesimus back by Philemon despite his inadequacies, that he (Paul) will cover the costs. But this time, not as a mere servant but as a brother in the Lord

text: The model example in St. Paul teaching on humility is _______
explanation: St Paul used the example of Jesus Christ, who through his humility, became elevated as Lord.

text: The core of Saul's disobedience was that___________

options.A: He didn't perform the task of smiting the Amalekites to the letter
options.B: He preserved the booty for himself
options.D: He refused to carry out God's assignment on eliminating the Amalekites

explanation: Saul actually carried out God's assignment to destroy Amalek. The gist of his disobedience was that he didn't perform this assignment according to the prescribed instructions, he spared Agag and reserved choice animals for himself

text: The Lord protected the Israelites with all but one of the following when the Egyptians chased them
explanation:
The Lord used his Angels, pillars of cloud, and darkness to obstruct the view of the Egyptians when they pursued the Israelites.
Pillar of storm is not part of the protection God used in guarding the Israelites against the attack of the Egyptians.

text: One derivative lesson from the story of Gehazi'z greed is that_______

options.A: We can by ourselves, through materialism, cause the destruction of generations yet unborn
options.B: Dishonesty should not have been a ground for cursing Gehazi with leprosy
options.C: As servants of God we must endeavour not to readily demand gifts from those we help
options.D: We should be wary of accepting gifts from the unrighteous

explanation: Ghazi not only destroyed himself but also ruined the lives of his descendants (The curse of leprosy upon him and his generations forever) as a result of greed and dishonesty.

text: Peter advised the young in his teaching on interpersonal relationship among Christains to ________

options.A: See themselves as strong and able-bodied servants of God

explanation: The youth according to Peter should be respectful and submissive to the elders in the Church. Whilst the elders lead exemplary lives

text: According to St James, 'He who keeps the whole law and fails in one is guilty of....'

options.A: Breaking the new commandment of Christ
options.B: Breaking that particular love and should pray for grace

explanation: St James advised Christians against partiality and corruption, saying that if they keep the whole law and fail in one by showing partiality

text: On the ________day, the child was _______and named Jesus
explanation: According to the account of Luke, Jesus was circumcised and named "Jesus' on the eight day

text: One of the most significant lessons from the healing of the Centurion's Servant is that ____________

options.A: Jesus has the power to forgive sins
options.B: The Level of faith of the servant made Jesus heal him
options.C: The Salvation of God is universal
options.D: Even the sons of the Kingdom are not worthy of God's Kingdom

explanation: Despite the fact that the Centurion was a Roman and not a Jew, Jesus healed his servant. This shows that salvation is open to all. NB; It was the Centurion's level of faith that Inspired this miracle and nor the Faith of his servant

text: Josiah sent _____the priest to inquire of the Lord from Huldah
explanation: The priest and Shaphan, the secretary were both sent by Josiah to inquire of the Lord from prophetess Huldah the wife of Shallim, on the meaning of the book of law found in the temple.

text: St James teaching on impartiality centers on_________

options.A: Giving the place of the rich to the poor and in the church
options.B: Loving our neighbours as ourselves in all situation
options.C: The rich spending their wealth on the poor for social equity
options.D: Christians not being partial to idle people

explanation: The subject matter of St James "Impartiality" is predicated upon selflessness and equal treatment of all categories and class of persons, as much as should be done in the church and the general society

text: The name "Jezreel" is a representation of ______

options.B: Victory upon the enemies of Israel
options.C: The Punishment to come unto the royal house
options.D: The broken covenant between God and Israel

explanation: Hosea named his first son Jezreel as a sign of the punishment to come upon the royal house

text: Moses named the place where the Israelites drank water from the rock "Mesah and Meribah' particularly because---------

options.A: They wanted to put the lord to test
options.B: They made him strike the rock angrily
options.C: The people had enough water to drink

explanation:
The names"Massah" and "Meribah"were given to the place where the Israelites complained about the lack of water in the wilderness and tested God's presence.
Massahmeans"testing", referring to how the Israelites questioned whether God was among them.Meribahmeans"quarreling", referring to their complaints against Moses and God.
This event is recorded inExodus 17:1–7, where the Israelites grumbled and doubted God's provision, saying,"Is the Lord among us or not?"(Exodus 17:7).

text: Abraham's faith was reckoned to him as righteousness'. This underscores St Paul's admonition that ______

options.A: Redemption in Christ is possible through observance of the law
options.C: Justification is by faith and nor the law
options.D: Obedience of the law is unnecessary as compared to God's grace

explanation: According to St Paul, Abraham was justified by faith and not by law, the implication of the Above statement

text: St Paul's epistle to the Philippians on "Christian Giving' indicated his reception of gifts from them through________
explanation: Epaphroditus was the envoy of the Philippians and Colossians who brought gifts to Paul while he was in prison in Rome.

text: The intent of the third temptation of Christ was to_____________

options.A: Make him focus on wordly possessions
options.C: Make him seem like a Magician
options.D: Make him see the riches of the world from a high mountain

explanation: By asking Jesus to fall down and bow to him, after showing him all the kingdoms of the world, Satan wanted Jesus to derail from his focus on the kingdom of God to the possession and control of his worldly kingdoms.

text: According to St Paul, God sent the spirit of his son into men's heart-----

options.A: So that become and act like a God
options.C: For the Redemption of their Sins

explanation: In ST Paul's teaching on Christians as sons and heirs of God, God sent the spirit of his Son into men's hearts crying. "Abba! Father!" and in effect making Christians sons and heirs of God rather being slaves

text: "For the men in the ship knew that he was fleeing from the presence of the Lord". The person referred to in this statement is________
explanation: The statement points at Jonah's flee, boarding a ship to Tarshish, in refusal to preach God's message of repentance to Nineveh

text: St Paul's teaching on spiritual gifts was directed to _______
explanation:
Paul's teaching onspiritual giftsis primarily found in1 Corinthians 12–14, where he explains the different gifts given by theHoly Spiritand their role in thechurch. He emphasizes that these gifts should be used for thecommon goodand thatlove (charity)is the greatest of all virtues (1 Corinthians 13).
Biblical Reference (1 Corinthians 12:4-7, RSV):
"Now there are varieties of gifts, but the same Spirit; and there are varieties of service, but the same Lord; and there are varieties of working, but it is the same God who inspires them all in every one. To each is given the manifestation of the Spirit for the common good."
Paul discussesgifts like prophecy, healing, speaking in tongues, and interpretation of tongues, encouraging unity in diversity within the church.

text: Cleopas' heart burnt within him on the road to Emmaus when Jesus ________
explanation: The story of Cleopas and another disciple on theroad to Emmausis found inLuke 24:13–35. They met Jesus unknowingly after His resurrection.Luke 24:32 (RSV):“They said to each other, ‘Did not our hearts burn within us while he talked to us on the road,while he opened to us the scriptures?’”This clearly shows that theburning of their heartswas in response toJesus' teaching and explanation of the Scripturesregarding Himself.

text: For how long did the Lord supply the children of Israel with manna in the wilderness?
explanation: The Israelites ate manna in the wilderness for forty years until they came to the border of the land of Canaan ( Exodus 16:35)

text: Only ...stated that the transfiguration took place eight days after Peter's confession of Jesus as the son of God.
explanation: The synoptic record of Luke added that Christ's transfiguration took place 8 days after the Peter confessed Jesus as the son of God. (Luke 9:28).

text: The Egyptians encamped at ____ when they pursued the Israelites
explanation: Pi-ha-hi-roth is the correct answer, the place where the Egyptians encamped in pursuit of the Israelites.

text: "I am the resurrection and the life, he who believes in me, though he dies, yet shall he live". Jesus directed this statement to
explanation: Martha is the correct answer. Jesus made the statement at the scene and setting of Lazarus' death

text: "Do not be afraid; for I know what you seek, Jesus who was crucified..." This statement was made__________

options.B: to Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James
options.C: to Mary Salome, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James

explanation: At the tomb, in a bid to anoint Jesus, Mary Salome, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James were told about the resurrection of Jesus. See-Mark 16:1.

text: "What you sow does not come to life unless it dies". This was______

options.A: the message of St. Paul's teaching on the second coming of Christ
options.B: made by St. Paul to Elymas, the magician
options.C: the statement of Jesus to Martha
options.D: the response St. Paul instructed Christians to give to those who doubt the resurrection of Christ

explanation: St. Paul used this statement as to charge Christians to logically respond to the unbelievers in Christ's resurrection.

text: In the Gospel according to St. Matthew, Jesus sent His disciples to_______
explanation: Jesus sent the disciples to the lost sheep of the house of Israel, the Jews, according to the report of St. Matthew. (Matthew 10:5-6)

text: "Who do men say that the Son of man is?" Jesus asked this question

options.A: to show that popular opinion matters the most in His recognition as Messiah
options.B: to indicate that the Jews and Pharisees need to reckon with His Messiahship
options.C: at the scene of His Transfiguration
options.D: in the context of the Great Confession

explanation: The emphasis of Jesus by asking the question in plainly in the context of the Great Confession and to show that popular thinking of the people doesn't count in honouring Him as a Messiah.

text: God charged man to 'be fruitful, and multiply, and .... the earth, and subdue it'. (1st creation story)
explanation:
The Revised Standard Version (RSV) of the Bible translates Genesis 1:28 as:
"And God blessed them, and God said to them, 'Be fruitful and multiply, andfillthe earth and subdue it; and have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over every living thing that moves upon the earth.'"

text: Since fervent prayers of the righteous has great power in its effects, Christians according to St. James must________
explanation: Christians must confess their sins before God and take conscious steps to forsake them as the prayer of the righteous answers fervently.

text: ... updated Nehemiah about the state of Jerusalem while he was ...
explanation: Hanai visited Nehemiah, a captive in Babylon and reported the state of Jerusalem to him.

text: When Jesus healed the paralytic, the anger of the scribes was aroused by His_______

options.A: refusal to show them signs of His divinity
options.B: nature of command to the paralytic
options.D: healing of the man on a Sabbath

explanation: The scribes were angered by Jesus' statement 'my son, your sins are forgiven' when He healed the paralytic. To them, such statement was blasphemous, as it is only God that can forgive sins.

text: "For I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice..." this statement relates to the_______

options.A: response of God's love to the children of Israel
options.B: response of Israel to the genuineness of God's love
options.C: message of God's love to man
options.D: message of Hosea on faithfulness and social progress

explanation: Response of Israel to the genuiness of God's love is the correct answer. In the message of Hosea on 'Divine Love', God issued the above statement to indicate that he prefered steadfast love to burnt offerings.

text: The most significant lesson at the scene of the Israelites' blame of Moses in their struggle and escape from Egypt is that___________

options.A: God hardened the heart of Pharaoh to pursue the Israelites
options.B: they would have perfered to stay back and die in Egypt
options.C: Moses' courage and confidence in God saved the entire situation
options.D: Moses' height of anger and intolerance was revealed

explanation: Moses' courage and confidence in God, even though there was to certainty of safety for the Israelites at the red sea as the Eyptians chased after them, is a stand-alone lesson to hold on to from the story.

text: When Ezekiel was called, he was shown a scroll on which were written words of______
explanation: In the preparation of Ezekiel to deliver God's message to Israel, God made him eat a scroll upon which there were written words of lamentation, mourning and woe.

text: The illustration of Satan, the adversary who prowls around seeking whom to devour, is particular to__________-

options.B: St. Paul's teaching on the second coming of Christ
options.C: St. Peter's teaching on civic responsibility

explanation: In St. Peter's teaching on humility, he advised that Christians be sober and watchful, for Satan, the adversary, prowls around seeking whom to devour.

text: Herod Agrippa persecuted Peter primarily to______

options.A: contain the news about Jesus' resurrection
options.B: signal to the Apostles that he wouldn't tolerate them
options.C: obstruct the spread of the gospel

explanation: Seeing as Herod Agrippa's previous killing of James, pleased the Jews. He persecuted Peter also for the same reason, as he wanted to win the confidence of the Jews in his government.

text: "Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, Hosanna in the highest!" This was... account of the Triumphal Entry
explanation: Matthew's synoptic account (in Matthew 21:9) is the authoritative answer to this. N.B: paying attention to little details a true quality of an Art and CRS student.

text: The essence of St. Paul's teaching on Law and Grace is that___________

options.A: observance of the law is necessary for redemption in Christ
options.B: what God truly rewards is the prayer for grace by Christians
options.C: observance of the law only isn't a guarantee of salvation
options.D: God's grace in Christians' lives shouldn't be a reason for continuing in sin

explanation: To St. Paul, strict observation of the law cannot guarantee salvation, what God truly rewards is faith, using the example of Abraham to support this.

text: One of the following is not a quality of good discipleship_________
explanation: Exuberance is the best answer as lowliness in spirit, without too much vigour for worldness, is key to true discipleship.

text: At about the ... hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice "Eli Eli lama sabach - thani".
explanation: At about the ninth hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice 'My God, my God why has thou forsaken me.'

text: The Last Supper refers the last meal Jesus had with His disciples immediately before His_____
explanation: Jesus ate the Last Supper with His disciples before His betrayal and arrest.

text: Paul taught that spiritual gifts in all their varieties emanate from____________
explanation: According to St. Paul, all the nine spiritual gifts are inspired by the same Spirit (God) who apportions to individuals as He wills. However, their usage must be for the common good of the 'body of Christ.'

text: To St. James, a doer of the word of God must learn to also__________

options.C: be a listener of the word of God

explanation: According to St. James a doer of the word must learn to control his tongue, as anyone who cannot do this, deceives himself and his religion is in vain.

text: St. Paul on 'Civic Responsibility' advised Christians not only to be law-abiding but also_________

options.A: to provide moral advice to those in authority
options.B: do what is expected of them

explanation: St. Paul advised that Christians be law-abiding as well as discharge their duties and obligation to the constituted authorities i.e payment of taxes, giving respect to whom respect is due etc.

text: Which of the following was Pilate's question to Jesus at his trial?

options.A: Are you Jesus, the prophet from Galilee?
options.C: Are you the king of the Jews?
options.D: What is it that these men testify against you?

explanation: 'Are you the king of the Jews?' Pilate asked Jesus at His trial.

text: According to Jeremiah, the Lord's new covenant will be made with the house of ... and the house of__________
explanation: According to the book of Jeremiah, the Lord will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah.

text: Joseph's leadership quality was so exceptional so much that__________

options.A: the Chief butler recommended him to Pharaoh
options.B: God rewarded his action of committing adultery with Potiphar's wife
options.C: Pharaoh had to appoint him as Emperor
options.D: other nations of the world benefited from it

explanation: Other nations of the world benefited from the exceptional leadership skills of Joseph -Egypt was the land of plenty sought after by other nations in the time of severe famine.

text: Nebuchadnezzer king of Babylon invaded Jerusalem and carried away all the treasures of the temple during the reign of_________
explanation: Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, first invaded Jerusalem during the reign ofKing Jehoiakimof Judah.2 Kings 24:1 (RSV):"In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant for three years..."Later, when Jehoiakim rebelled, Nebuchadnezzar returned and eventually carried away treasures from the temple and deported many people.2 Kings 24:13 (RSV):"And he carried off all the treasures of the house of the Lord and the treasures of the king's house..."

text: In Matthew's account, John the Baptist's immediate reaction when Jesus came to be baptized was to_______

options.A: ask that Jesus should rather baptize him
options.B: ask why he should baptize a non-sinner
options.C: wait for the promise of the manifestation of God's glory

explanation: John the Baptist asked that he should rather be baptized by Jesus. (Matthew 3:14)

text: Peter refuted the mockery of drunkenness of the disciples by referring to the prophecy of________
explanation: "... but this is what was spoken of by the Prophet Joel", Peter said, when people mocked the disciples of drunkiness while speaking in tongues.
